stories.title: Young People Are Leaving Their Jobs in Record Numbers–and Not Going Back
The 37-Year-Olds Are Afraid of the 23-Year-Olds Who Work for Them

stories.text:
Unfortunately, there's so much good content on Medium that appears at the top of Google search as well, but non-subscribers are deprived of such content.

At the same time, I see lots of discussion here on HN about how many developers care for the free and open internet. How is it then, that many developers write and contribute to such paywall websites?

And it's not just Medium. Many websites are built on Medium and they too get paywalled.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why do developers blog on Medium while it's paywalled?
Mark Zuckerberg’s Facebook fight is about silencing right-wing voices
Kompute: General purpose GPU compute framework for cross vendor graphics cards
Definition of 'fully vaccinated' could change, CDC chief says. What that means

stories.text:
Fellow HNers,

I'm finding that with work from home, it helps to give myself a change of scenery by working in different parts of the house.

Whilst I could simply do this with my laptop, I much prefer working on large displays.

I have a wireless Lenovo keyboard (which has a built-in mouse trackpoint), and I'd like to place a large monitor in 3 separate areas of the house.

I also want to be able to walk around the house seamlessly and work on any of the displays - without having to plug/unplug anything.

What's the best way to do this?

Thanks! ^_^
stories.title: Ask HN: How to? Multiple monitors across house, exact same output
G-20 world leaders formally endorse global corporate minimum tax
Companies Pay New Workers Higher Wages, Current Employees Ask, ‘What About Us?’
